t: Proverbs 1
The Usefulness of Proverbs
The*p proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:
To*pn know wisdom and instruction, To*ln discern the sayings of understanding,
To*ln receive instruction in wise behavior, Righteousness,*ln justice and equity;
To*ln give prudence to the naive, To*ln the youth knowledge and discretion,
A*ln wise man will hear and increase in learning, And*ln a man of understanding will acquire wise counsel,
To*ln understand a proverb and a figure, The*ln words of the wise and their riddles.
The*ln fear of the Lord*s is the beginning of knowledge; Fools*ln despise wisdom and instruction.
The Enticement of Sinners
Hear,*pn my son, your father’s instruction And*ln do not forsake your mother’s teaching;
Indeed,*ln they are a graceful wreath to your head And*ln ornaments about your neck.
My*ln son, if sinners entice you, Do*ln not consent.
If*ln they say, “Come with us, Let*ln us lie in wait for blood, Let*ln us ambush the innocent without cause;
Let*ln us swallow them alive like Sheol, Even*ln whole, as those who go down to the pit;
We*ln will find all kinds*i of precious wealth, We*ln will fill our houses with spoil;
Throw*ln in your lot with us, We*ln shall all have one purse,”
My*ln son, do not walk in the way with them. Keep*ln your feet from their path,
For*ln their feet run to evil And*ln they hasten to shed blood.
Indeed,*ln it is useless to spread the baited*i net In*ln the sight of any bird;
But*ln they lie in wait for their own blood; They*ln ambush their own lives.
So*ln are the ways of everyone who gains by violence; It*ln takes away the life of its possessors.
Wisdom Warns
Wisdom*pn shouts in the street, She*ln lifts her voice in the square;
At*ln the head of the noisy streets*i she cries out; At*ln the entrance of the gates in the city she utters her sayings:
“How*ln long, O naive ones, will you love being simple-minded? And*ln scoffers delight themselves in scoffing And*ln fools hate knowledge?
Turn*ln to my reproof, Behold,*ln I will pour out my spirit on you; I*ln will make my words known to you.
Because*ln I called and you refused, I*ln stretched out my hand and no one paid attention;
And*ln you neglected all my counsel And*ln did not want my reproof;
I*ln will also laugh at your calamity; I*ln will mock when your dread comes,
When*ln your dread comes like a storm And*ln your calamity comes like a whirlwind, When*ln distress and anguish come upon you.
Then*ln they will call on me, but I will not answer; They*ln will seek me diligently but they will not find me,
Because*ln they hated knowledge And*ln did not choose the fear of the Lord.*s
They*ln would not accept my counsel, They*ln spurned all my reproof.
So*ln they shall eat of the fruit of their own way And*ln be satiated with their own devices.
For*ln the waywardness of the naive will kill them, And*ln the complacency of fools will destroy them.
But*ln he who listens to me shall live securely And*ln will be at ease from the dread of evil.”
